alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 11 at 9:07PM PST until February 14 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches possible, with up to 12 inches possible on highway 227 south of Tiller. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph over high exposed terrain. * WHERE...The passes on I-5 Between Sexton Summit and Canyon Creek Pass, and south of Medford to Ashland. Highways 227, 42, 199 near and at Hays Hill Summit and near Obrien, 238, and the foothills within Jackson, Josephine, Eastern Curry, Coos, and Douglas Counties. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected on the valley floors Monday night. Most of the accumulating snow is possible Monday night into Tuesday morning along and behind the second cold front. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
